cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SE. 

The paper proposes an approach for representing scientific claims using English sentences, which can be used to broaden the application range of nanopublications. This approach involves a syntactic and semantic scheme called AIDA, which provides a uniform and succinct representation of scientific assertions. The paper also discusses the advantages of nanopublications, such as information sharing and interlinking of scientific findings. Based on this information, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are artificial intelligence (cs.AI), databases (cs.DB), information retrieval (cs.IR), machine learning (cs.LG), and software engineering (cs.SE).
